questions.question: The coefficient of permeability of coarse sand is

explanations.a: The permeability of silt is 10<sup>-5</sup> cm/sec.
explanations.c: The permeability of coarse soil is 1 - 0.1 cm/sec.

questions.question: In laboratory, permeability of the soil can be found by

explanations.a: Constant head permeability is one of the methods used to find permeability of soil where constant head is maintained throughout the experiment.
explanations.b: Variable head permeability is another method used to find permeability of soil where head varies.
explanations.c: In the laboratory Both constant head and variable head method is used to find permeability of soil.
explanations.d: Correct answer is mentioned in the above option.

questions.question: Which of the following sentence is correct?

answers.a: Fine grained  soil is used for constant head permeability tests.
answers.b: Coefficient of permeability is rate at which water flows through unit cross sectional area under a hydraulic gradient.
answers.c: Permeability is the property of soil where water is not allowed to percolate through voids.
answers.d: Coefficient of viscosity is the ability of water to pass through the voids present in it.

explanations.a: For constant head permeability test coarse grained soils are used.
explanations.b: Permeability is the flow of water through the pores present in the soil. Coefficient of permeability is the rate at which water flows through  unit cross sectional area under hydraulic gradient.
explanations.c: Permeability is the property of soil where water is allowed to percolate through voids.
explanations.d: Coefficient of viscosity is resistance offered to the flow of liquid.

questions.question: The  permeability of silty sand is  10<sup>-3</sup> - 10<sup>-4</sup> cm/sec

explanations.a: The sentence provided above is true. The permeability of silty sand is 10<sup>-3</sup> - 10<sup>-4</sup> cm/sec.
explanations.b: This option is wrong. The permeability of silty sand is 10<sup>-3</sup> - 10<sup>-4</sup> cm/sec.

questions.question: Permeability can be determined by direct measurement with the help of

explanations.a: Permeameter is the instrument used to take direct measurement of permeability of soil.
explanations.b: Consolidation test is used to determine the settlement of soil.
explanations.c: Horizontal capillary test is used to determine the capillary pressure of saturated soil.
explanations.d: Pumping out test is conducted to measure the water level response.
